<p> TimeSensor continuously generates events as time passes. Typical use: ROUTE thisTimeSensorDEF.fraction_changed TO someInterpolatorDEF.set_fraction. </p> <p> X3D Tooltips of interest: <a href="https://www.web3d.org/x3d/tooltips/X3dTooltips.html#TimeSensor" target="_blank">TimeSensor</a>. </p> <p> <a href="https://www.web3d.org/documents/specifications/19775-1/V3.3/Part01/Architecture.html" target="_blank">X3D Specification</a> sections of interest: <a href="https://www.web3d.org/documents/specifications/19775-1/V3.3/Part01/components/time.html" target="_blank">8 Time component</a>, <a href="https://www.web3d.org/documents/specifications/19775-1/V3.3/Part01/components/time.html#Concepts" target="_blank">8.2 Concepts</a> and <a href="https://www.web3d.org/documents/specifications/19775-1/V3.3/Part01/components/time.html#TimeSensor" target="_blank">8.4.1 TimeSensor</a>. </p> <p> <a href="https://www.web3d.org/x3d/content/examples/X3dResources.html#Examples" target="_blank">X3D Examples Archives</a> of related interest: </p> <ul> <li> VRML 2 Sourcebook:&nbsp; <a href="https://www.web3d.org/x3d/content/examples/Vrml2Sourcebook/Chapter08AnimatingPositionOrientationScale" target="_blank">Chapter 08 Animating Position Orientation Scale</a> </li> <li> X3D for Web Authors: <a href="http://x3dgraphics.com/examples/X3dForWebAuthors/Chapter07EventAnimationInterpolation" target="_blank">Chapter 07 Event Animation Interpolation</a> </li> </ul>
